intro: Gilibertia insularis, commonly known as the island gilibertia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Gilibertia insularis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
